result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Adjoining States. Signed by SRN on 10/27/22. arc   c: SCSO with complaint   e: DA and Atty Dolfi.arc

9:33 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Ariel Adriana Mackey not in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Ariel Adriana Mackey.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file and notes DE was approved to appear by zoom but not in waiting room. State requesting warrant. Court issues WARRANT- Extraditable from Adjoining states. Adjourned at 9:36 AM. bph

Request for DE to appear by zoom for tomorrows PSC block, 10/27/22, filed by Atty Dolfi.   Per SRN on 10-26-22:  In person is preferred, if DE's ride falls through, then Zoom is approved. JA will advise Atty. Dolfi. bph

2:19 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Ariel Adriana Mackey appeared by phone.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Ariel Adriana Mackey.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE was approved to appear by zoom for today but having technical difficulties DE approved to appear by telephone today.  Court reviews file and notes absconder status report filed by JSC.  Tina S. from JSC states DE did call and was advised on today's hearings.  DE states she has arranged for transportation for next weeks hearing.  Court orders DE to continue to make calls to JSC. Adjourned at 2:23 PM. bph

11:04 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi, DF: Ariel Adriana Mackey appeared.  S/T of Max Berger of Hudson PD.  Direct by ADA Ellenwood. Cross by Atty Dolfi. Redirect by ADA Ellenwood.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.   Court will proceed to ARGN, ADA Ellenwood states Information will mirror complaint.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on both counts.  If next hearing is scheduling only, DE approved to appear by zoom.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 11:21 AM. bph  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Filed by Atty Dolfi. km

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Dolfi. km
By Keven H - 22R 006886. jaf
Pretrial Assessment Report. hml
Preliminary hearing on May 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Must test clean before release.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. DE to call in 1 time per week to verify address. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Liddle ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi for purposes of today  DF:  Ariel Adriana Mackey appeared from jail. DE will need to follow up to see if qualifies for PD services. Address and DOB confirmed. DE has a copy of complaint.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
